paragraphs.text:
%md
# HyperLogLog

Hyperloglog addresses the problem in determining cardinality on large datasets. Usefull for efficiantly summerizing streams of data such as number of unique visitors of a website or counting ad impressions.

msg.data:
HyperLogLog

Hyperloglog addresses the problem in determining cardinality on large datasets. Usefull for efficiantly summerizing streams of data such as number of unique visitors of a website or counting ad impressions.

paragraphs.title: Add Spark Dependencies
paragraphs.text:
%dep

//Add these dependencies to the interpreter to make your life easier...

z.reset()
z.load("com.twitter:algebird-core_2.11:0.13.3")
z.load("org.apache.bahir:spark-streaming-twitter_2.10:2.1.0")

paragraphs.title: Create Keyspace
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE KEYSPACE IF NOT EXISTS approximations WITH REPLICATION = { 'class' : 'SimpleStrategy', 'replication_factor' : 1 };

paragraphs.title: Create Table
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS approximations.hlldata ( id text, date text, batchtime timestamp, batchwindow int, totalinwindow int, uniqueperbatch int, hllstore blob, PRIMARY KEY ((id, date), batchTime));

paragraphs.title: Create Search Index for Timeseries
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE SEARCH  INDEX IF NOT EXISTS ON approximations.hlldata WITH COLUMNS batchtime, uniqueperbatch;

paragraphs.title: Approximate Unique Twitter Users from Live Stream
paragraphs.text:
%spark

import com.twitter.algebird.HyperLogLog._
import com.twitter.algebird.HyperLogLogMonoid
import org.apache.log4j.{Level, Logger}

import org.apache.spark.SparkConf
import org.apache.spark.storage.StorageLevel
import org.apache.spark.streaming.{Seconds, StreamingContext}
import org.apache.spark.streaming.twitter._
import twitter4j.conf.ConfigurationBuilder
import twitter4j.auth.OAuthAuthorization
import java.util.Date
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat
import com.datastax.spark.connector.streaming._
import com.datastax.spark.connector._
import com.datastax.spark.connector.SomeColumns

/**
 * Example of using HyperLogLog monoid from Twitter's Algebird together with Spark Streaming's
 * TwitterInputDStream
 */

    /** Bit size parameter for HyperLogLog, trades off accuracy vs size */
    val BIT_SIZE = 12
    
    //Size of window in Stream Processing
    val WINDOW_SIZE = 10
    val minutesToStream = 10;
    
    val filters = new Array[String](0)
    
    //BYO Credentials
    val cb = new ConfigurationBuilder();
    cb.setDebugEnabled(true)
      .setOAuthConsumerKey("gHR0H9mDEtP7jDm0pDxn1mGTF")
      .setOAuthConsumerSecret("wFmr8y29mlvhWiTCT3nta6jxVGWXsi0mTl6OhZf94gYUihjkA6")
      .setOAuthAccessToken("58465931-2gN1Ofp7Smyg0A0h8EWsbTDAd39LgLfO7WAnfGFeH")
      .setOAuthAccessTokenSecret("v7cEbLGw0vwkuuGsZsabsMWmZMjCz7C2Nev9TXRa9xW8I")
  
   
    val auth = new OAuthAuthorization(cb.build)
    
    val ssc = new StreamingContext(sc, Seconds(WINDOW_SIZE))
    
    val stream = TwitterUtils.createStream(ssc, Some(auth), filters, StorageLevel.MEMORY_ONLY_SER)

    val users = stream.map(status => status.getUser.getId)

    val hll = new HyperLogLogMonoid(BIT_SIZE)
    
    val approxUsers = users.mapPartitions(ids => {
      ids.map(id => hll.create(id))
    }).reduce(_ + _)

    val todayAsString = new SimpleDateFormat("MM-dd-yyyy").format(new Date())
   
    approxUsers.foreachRDD(rdd => {
      val totalInWindow = rdd.count();
      if (totalInWindow != 0) {
       
        val now = new Date();
       
        val partial = rdd.first()
       
        val uniqueperbatch = partial.estimatedSize.toInt
        
        println("Approx distinct users this batch: %d".format(uniqueperbatch))
        
        val oneWindowValue = sc.parallelize(Seq(("tweets", todayAsString, now, WINDOW_SIZE, totalInWindow, uniqueperbatch, toBytes(partial))))
       
        oneWindowValue.saveToCassandra("approximations", "hlldata", SomeColumns("id", "date", "batchtime", "batchwindow", "totalinwindow", "uniqueperbatch", "hllstore"))

      }
    })


    ssc.start()
    ssc.awaitTerminationOrTimeout(minutesToStream * 60  * 1000)//2 minutes...
    ssc.stop(stopSparkContext = false, stopGracefully=true)

paragraphs.title: Approximate Unique Twitter Users by Aggregating Window Approximations
paragraphs.text:
%spark
import com.datastax.spark.connector.streaming._
import com.datastax.spark.connector._
import com.datastax.spark.connector.SomeColumns
import com.datastax.spark.connector.rdd._
import org.apache.spark.SparkContext    
import org.apache.spark.SparkContext._
import org.apache.spark.SparkConf
import org.apache.spark.storage.StorageLevel
import org.apache.spark.streaming.{Seconds, StreamingContext}

import com.twitter.algebird.HyperLogLog._
import com.twitter.algebird.HyperLogLogMonoid
import org.apache.log4j.{Level, Logger}
import com.twitter.algebird.HLL
import java.util.Date
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat

val todayAsString = new SimpleDateFormat("MM-dd-yyyy").format(new Date())
   
val rdd  = sc.cassandraTable[Array[Byte]]("approximations", "hlldata")
              .select("hllstore")
              .where("id = ?", "tweets").where("date = ?", todayAsString)

val approxUsers = rdd.mapPartitions(ids => {
  ids.map(id => fromBytes(id))
}).reduce(_ + _)

val hllagg = approxUsers.estimatedSize.toInt

println("Total For HLL:"+hllagg)

paragraphs.title: Create Table to Store Aggregate Results
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS approximations.hlldataaggregate ( id text, date text, batchtime timestamp, batchwindow int, totalinwindow int, uniqueperbatch int, hllstore blob, PRIMARY KEY ((id, date), batchTime));

paragraphs.title: Create Search Index For Aggregate Results
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE SEARCH INDEX IF NOT EXISTS ON approximations.hlldataaggregate WITH COLUMNS id, date, batchtime, uniqueperbatch;

paragraphs.title: Store Aggregate Results
paragraphs.text:
%spark

import com.datastax.spark.connector.streaming._
import com.datastax.spark.connector._
import com.datastax.spark.connector.SomeColumns
import com.datastax.spark.connector.rdd._
import org.apache.spark.SparkContext    
import org.apache.spark.SparkContext._
import org.apache.spark.SparkConf
import org.apache.spark.storage.StorageLevel
import org.apache.spark.streaming.{Seconds, StreamingContext}

import com.twitter.algebird.HyperLogLog._
import com.twitter.algebird.HyperLogLogMonoid
import org.apache.log4j.{Level, Logger}
import com.twitter.algebird.HLL
import java.util.Date
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat

val todayAsString = new SimpleDateFormat("MM-dd-yyyy").format(new Date())
   
val rdd  = sc.cassandraTable[Array[Byte]]("approximations", "hlldata")
              .select("hllstore")
              .where("id = ?", "tweets").where("date = ?", todayAsString).where("batchtime > ?", new Date(System.currentTimeMillis() - (30 * 60 * 1000)))

val approxUsers = rdd.mapPartitions(ids => {
  ids.map(id => fromBytes(id))
}).reduce(_ + _)

val hllagg = approxUsers.estimatedSize.toInt

val oneWindowValue = sc.parallelize(Seq(("tweets", todayAsString, new Date(), 0, 1, hllagg, toBytes(approxUsers))))

println("Total For HLL:"+hllagg)

oneWindowValue.saveToCassandra("approximations", "hlldataaggregate", SomeColumns("id", "date", "batchtime", "batchwindow", "totalinwindow", "uniqueperbatch", "hllstore"))

%cassandra

SELECT * FROM approximations.hlldata WHERE id = 'tweets' ALLOW FILTERING;
